Wat was dit een aanschaf zeg, ze zeiden het al bij het wijndomein zelf: "dit is een topjaar". En ze hebben gelijk gekregen. Nu nóg een tikje mooier dan tijdens mijn laatste (sept '22) en eerdere TNs. Perfecte balans, nog een beetje meer aards, zo complex.

Der Name Vasconcellos verbindet man an sich mit den besten Portweinen. Hier geht's allerdings um einen limitiert produzierten Rotwein. 
Dieser Douro liegt dunkelrot mit lila Reflexen im Glas. Tiefe Atemzüge durch die Nase werden mit angenehmen Noten von Leder und Waldpilzen belohnt. Auf dem Gaumen finden sich die Geschmacksrichtungen von schwarzer Pfeffer, Pflaumen und Kirschen.
Tanta robina

Oak, tobacco to your nose. Red cherry and dark fruit to your palate. Heavy tears, deep dark red.color. Full bodied Douro. Long nice finish

Ooh lovely drop this one, fruit forward on the nose, black fruit in the palate with a lovely peppery finish. Bold and tannic, quite dry with medium acidity. The bad thing is I could easily drink way too much if this!! 
👃 blackberry strawberry cheese
👅 plum black cherry pepper oak

A very solid product that shows maturity, smoothness, and depth. Deep, dark dried cherry, plum, black fruit, a bit of spice, some earth, leather and a finish of mellow oak. This is aging well and will go great with grilled meats and vegetables.
Deep and powerful. Aromas of red fruit, floral  spice and menthol. Black cherry, red plum and leather flavours. Demands hearty food.

An organic blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca & others, aged 10m in French oak. Great value.

Deep ruby. Youthful w. blackberry, damson, black cherry, cassis & purity of plump ripe fruit. A floral violet note & an attractive touch of summer day asphalt.

Dry. Med bodied w. med rounded tannins, m+ alc, m+ acid & m+ flavour intensity. Ripe blackberry,  silky black cherry, damson, wild strawberry & a lightly earthy spice of tar & liquorice. Violet & dried dark flowers w. a well balanced m+ finish.
oak, blackberry, plum, cherry, another good wine, slightly heavier than the others, good tipple this

Earthy, tobacco and leather on the nose with background brambles. Tastes smooth with blackcurrant or blackberry initially but the tannins come through later....Long finish. Brilliant with meat pie and excellent on its own after, great wine plus organic!
Really delicate, notes of red fruit, fir tree and earth. Super refreshing, just a bit too sweet.
Nice. Rich and smooth, jammy fruit.
Really tasty wine from the Duoro Valley! Excellent prize-quality ratio!
Loveeed it! Full body, red & dark fruit flavours. Leaves cinnamon, ginger tones on back of my palette which give pleasant aftertaste
Oak, plum, black fruit, red currant, leather, nice sweet and sour notes on palate,
Again bursting with dark cranberry and plum characters and a note of blackberry.
Excellent. Great complexity, mushroom, forest floor, tobacco, dark fruit and beautifully rounded tannins. Went very nicely with roast fillet of beef
Spicy, full body
Very dark and intense on every level. Overflowing with black fruit, lots of oak, leathery hints and some herbaceous, bitter twist. Good, powerful wine!
Gorgeous plum color. Red and black fruit on the nose, earthy minerals on the palate, and a long and slightly tannic finish. Really nice non-port wine from the Douro.
A rich and bold red with leather, blackberry, cassis, oak, dark fruit and plum notes. Grippy tannins. Perfect with beef, game, chicken and fatty meats.
Notes of cherry, black currant and slightly nutty in this smooth Douro. Really enjoyed this fuller bodied wine which had a lingering finish too. Excellent & would recommend.

Beautiful. 

Everything you want. 

Smoke, blackberry and oak. Amazing balance with a great finish and lovely yannis that cling to your tongue and make the Berries come to life.
Warm but light with predominantly blueberry, dark fruit and vanilla flavours. Faint undertones of fennel which give it some warmth and depth despite being otherwise quite light.
Truly delicious - dark fruit and berry on the palate, full-bodied, ripe and highly drinkable. Notes of Port in the nose - proper Douro experience. Great value too, a 4.25-
Blackberries, black cherries, a little oaky and a touch of liquorice. Delicious and smooth with decent tannins and lots of body.
Not quite full-bodied with distinct blackberry and red berry flavors and chewy tannins. Edgy and tasty though not my favorite.

3.7
Smell: Forest floor, dark fruit, pepper, hint of vanilla
Taste: blackberry, blueberry, raspberry, plum, oak, some tobacco

Dinner wine. I have had several bottles of this the last year, a very nice value Douro in a style that really reminds me of a Bordeaux. Earthy, tobacco, spicy sweet licorice, dark plum fruit. Nice concentration, acidity and tannins. This drinks very well now and will be interesting to age, if I manage to hide away some!

Lovely, heavy ruby color, very aromatic with notes of cherry, dark fruit and tobacco. Excellent balance, medium bodied with a great finish that leaves a slightly fresh keeping the fruit presence. Great option. It’s a wine with 6 years and still have this liveness. 💪🏻🍷

The grapes for Quinta do Ataide Tinto are a typical Douro field blend of Tourigo Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Barroca, Tinta Roriz and Tinto Cao.
Displaying on both the nose and the palate a beautiful bouquet of blackberry preserves, red plum fruit, spice box scents and hints of vanillin, dark chocolate and some toasted bread sensations.
Excellent balance between the fruit - sugars and acids, with ripe tannins and a medium lasting finale.

Deep ruby colour. Medium (+) and developing nose with dark plum, blackberry, dark cherry, tobacco, cedar, vanilla, blueberry, black pepper, licorice and violet. Medium (+) taste of dark plum, blackberry, dark cherry, blueberry, tobacco, cedar, vanilla, black pepper, licorice, cinnamon and raisin. Long and dry finish. Medium acidity. High tannins. Medium body. A very good Douro Red that has matured well. Needed over an hour of air to open. Drink now. Goes well with beef or lamb.

Clear medium intense, deep ruby red color pale on the rim medium viscosity. 
Clear medium intense, fruity, dark berries, floral, wet forest, black currant, blackberry on the nose.
Clear medium intense, dry, medium acidity, soft integrated tannins, medium bodied, plum zest, dark fruit, black cherry, blueberries, black plum and pine on the palate. 
Tasted at the sommelier education

Quite basic but well balanced wine from a large producer. Organic blend of 5T from a good vintage. Decant properly! 
L: garnet, violet rims, tiny legs at abv.13,5%. Med.intense, focused N: expressed violets, dark fruits and a back wall of tar. Reviving hints of mint, sage. P: full bodied, fruity, dry&bold. Dense but polished tannins, intense acidity-convincing backbone. Chalky, chocolaty notes makes it pleasant at finale. Warming, med.long aftertaste. Well priced evening star to support a beef shin. 3,7-3,8

A very good Douro wine. Dark red colour and full bodied. Bold and slightly tannic which makes a great companion to beef and wild dishes. Strong nose of oak and tobacco with more fruit blooming after 1:30 hour of decanting. Dark fruit, blueberry, oak and leather aromas are noticible. The wine is also quite long on the pallet.

Tried the 2016 vintage and was surprised by the colour, this dark ruby with deep purple highlights. Note that even for a 6 years old wine, it was not very leggy. It is a dry wine, no doubt, with aromas of blackcurrant and black cherry, a bit of tobacco too, but not very pungent. The mouthful was pleasant, not too strong on the tannins, medium bodied I found it. 
All in all, a decent wine, was probably expecting more depth of flavour for this vintage. 
Paired it with slow roasted lamb for Easter roast.

Big fan of Douro reds and this is a nice example. Deep ruby with good intensity of rich black fruit on the nose (blackberry, black cherry), vanilla and a bit of pungent spice coming through too. 

Fair grip on the tannins and nice length of finish.

Dark prune color with purple edges. 

Aroma of cigar, plum, fall leaves, blackberry, and mint. Juicy and dry taste with a long, dry finish. Best with food: Red meat, cured meat, aged cheese. 

Good now, but can live for up to 10 years in the cellar. 

88pt

2016 vintage. A blend of mostly touriga nacional and touriga franca along with a host of other indigenous grape varieties. Popped and poured which was a mistake as the wine was tannic and tight. I saved some for day 2 and by then it had mellowed out with juicy red fruit underpinning a long finish. 3.75 ⭐
Still very tannic for 6ys old, bit rough and some dryness. Great winery, though! Notes of black fruit, chocolate, earthy. Paired with chicken broth and rabbit stew.
2016. Big, bold wine with lots of dark fruit, blackberry and lots of acidity - not that well integrated. Gave it lots of time but didn’t really open out as hoped.

👀 Medium purple color. 
👃🏻The nose is offering  blackberry
👅 The palate is offering  oak, vanilla, tobacco and plum

Vintage 2016 opened in 2021
Alc. 13,5%
Fantastic bottle. Fruity and easy to drink but with enough depth to keep it interesting. I’d buy this again defo.
Super smooth and dry. Oak and tobacco notes. Fruity with a long lingering finish.  Very good Douro wine.

Good enough but we had higher expectations from the winery that makes Post Scriptum, one of our favorite Douro wines.
Oak, cherry, dried fruit, pepper and some earthy tones. Pretty decent.

It’s a good wine, smooth and easy to drink. I just wanted something a bit more exciting
2nd day I finished the bottle with 1 large glass left. It was much more interesting
Great value for money! A nice blend with round edges. Lots of ripe red fruit and wood with a hint of vanilla. Tried it with a few different types of meat and it always works
It's a good red, nothing wrong with it. And it's good enough to vouch the 4

Symington Family Estats. Vinho Tinto. DOC Douro. Val de Vilariça, Noroeste de Douro Superior. Vino Orgánico. Uvas tradicionales. Viñedo Certificado de Quinta do Ataíde. 14.5%, 2015. Aromático, entra agradable, sedoso, finura.

Vinhos de Portugal 2019 - JK Iguatemi. Um douro de boa qualidade sem ser particularmente marcante. t
Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca, Tinto Cão. Cerca de 10 meses de carvalho. Cor rubi. Aromas  com presença de frutas maus escuras, e suave tostado. Na boca, tem bom equilíbrio, com boa acidez, taninos de boa qualidade e final médio que acrescenta um lado mais especiado. 3.8
Um pouco seco para um Douro! Não tão encorpado, leve, bom para acompanhar massas!
Excelente corpo, intenso e com a Madeira bem notada
Coloração vinho bem escuro e opaco (não filtrado?), até meio arroxeada, com bouquet de madeira mofada incrível, tanino delicioso e bem herbáceo! Vinho muito bom do bom e Velho Mundo!

Ótimo vinho! Encorpado, com taninos redondos e aromas que lembram chocolate e couro.
90/100. Неожиданно элегантно. Малина, клубника, рябина, дорожная пыль, розы, одеколон. Бордоские танины, хороший баланс, вкус и послевкусие на уровне.

Very unusual wine. Needed 24 hours to properly open up! Peppery and earthy and very unusual. Interesting, complex with cherry on the finish
Dark red dence. On the nose violet wood tar earthy. On the pallette cherries plums violets wood medium body. Long aftertaste.
Plums and earth on the nose and dark berries and tannins on the palate. Seldom disappointed with the good producers like this from Douro area.
Earthy, mushrooms & leather, black cherry, & pepper. Dark inky purple hue, but with a light body. The finish is bing cherry rhubarb tart and juicy.

👃 licorice white pepper plum earthy red fruit raspberry blackcurrant 
👅 red fruit cherry plum raspberry pepper blueberry smoke minerals leather

Beautiful, easy drinking Douro red. Dominant red fruit and minerality on the nose, truly elegant and balanced on the palate with great acidity, soft tannins and those clear schist, chalky notes as the name implies. Not super complex, but extremely well put together - 4⭐️

30 % touriga Franca, 20 % tinta amarela, 20 % tinta roriz, 10 % rufete and 10 % tinta barroca. Fresh and youthful Douro with dark berries, plums, anise and some leather on the nose. Medium body. Juicy with dense ripe dark fruit and a nice amount of tannic resistance. Good length. Tight dry finish.

Interesting to be served a wine from the Douro region while doing a degustation in Santiago on Galicia.  However, makes sense since the Galician wines lack the body, structure, and tannins. To the contrary, this is tight and grippy. Served with a big flavored steak tartare and it held up well.

An elegant and enjoyable Douro Tinto. 30% Touriga Franca, 20% Tinta Amarela, 20% Tinta Roriz, 10% Rufete, 10% Tinta Barroca, 5% Malvasia Petra, 5% Donzelinho Tinto. Paired very well with eggplant pasta. 
12.5% alcohol. Deep purple color. Medium+ intensity youthful nose of minerality, plum, licorice, pomegranate. Dry full body, medium+ acidity, and high tannins. Medium+ intensity flavors of cranberry, pomegranate, plum, stone, fennel. Medium+ length finish. (2022)

Eye: Beautiful deep color with nice curtains.
Nose: A typical Portuguese scent. Oak, cherry 🍒 and leather. Lavendel and a hint of dark chocolate 🍫. Some vanilla and juniper. 
Taste: Cherries 🍒 and cherry stones. A hint of dark chocolate 🍫. Strawberry 🍓 ans some sweetness of wild strawberries 🍓.

This is really a delightful Portuguese wonder. It’s a wine with more subtlety than other big Duoros. I had a dodgy bottle in my last batch but that was clearly an aberration. It’s rich and full on the nose and you might not choose it for lunch expecting it to be heavy and sugary but it really isn’t. It’s extremely compatible and I’ve tried it with seafood - it added to the whole experience - I just need to be sitting by the beach in Portugal! I hope you are. I can’t be arsed to fly with airports as they are.

So nice it is with dark cherries some vanilla on the nose. Nice well balanced fruity taste, cherries and cask notes. Eight (8) different grapes (some of them used for making port wine) in this bottle made a great wine.

Great color.  👃 nose is full of fruit,  some vegetables,  soome wood. D
Serve cold, it will change with temperature rising. Must bd a blend of Tinta Roriz and Touriga national.  Nice tannins.  Elegant.  Great with pasta.

Still very young. Very tight, but it bloooms into fresh deliciousness after about an hour or two in a large decanter. The nose is super elegant with minerality, pungent forest floor, and dark fruit. Once open the palate is juicy, acidic, with more minerality, super ripe black fruit, dark fruit, black pepper. Very elegant, light and moody. Has the weight of a burgundy with the darkness of a syrah. Over delivers for an entry level and at this price point. Paired well with a lamb burger but you can go lighter.

Portugal Collection tasting ; dark ruby red color with purplish reflections; on the nose layered perfumes with blue and blackberry, toasted wood, vanilla, violets, candied figs and bramble; on the palate lively tannins and acidity, herbal, somewhat drying; wine with aging potential.

Nice aqcuaintance. Dense dark red in color and a modest nose. A surprisingly full body of dark and red fruits and berries carried by a pleasantly fresh acidity with a long lasting taste. Perfect fresh red wine.
Paired with stuffed gourgette flowers and lamb, delicious. Medium body with quite some structure, yet gentle tannins. Some spicy, peppery tones.

Very unique field blend that totally kicks ass! Medium bodied packed with black and blue fruit.  Tasting notes of blueberry, wet rock, black fig, bakers chocolate, and lavender on the finish.  Pair with manchego and lamb prosciutto.

4.1⭐️ (89 POINTS)

As far as I’m concerned, Portugal is still the country to beat when it comes to QPR, especially in the €20-30 price range.

👁 Bright medium purple.

👃 Strawberry, cherry, plum, violets, leather, pepper, herbal notes and hints of oak.

👄 Juicy and concentrated, but with bright acidity. Cherry, plum, white pepper and herbal notes. Dry earthy finish with fine grained tannins. Long. Pair with tapas, pizza or meaty pasta dishes.

Pale lemon in color with a developing medium intensity nose. Ginger, lemon, lemon curd, cream, yellow apple, saline, limestone chalk. Dry, high acidity, medium bodied, medium alcohol and medium plus intensity on the body. Yellow apple, lime, lemon, saline, minerality, cream, green apple. Outstanding quality of wine. 4.1 stars. Can drink now, suitable for further aging. 


90% aged in neutral oak.
White wines from Portugal are underrated, but on a positive site they are cheaper. Expressive fruit notes, pale straw color.
Super high acid but low tannins. Notes of cherry, leather, apricot and earthy. Delicious and well balanced
Thanks treat. A delicious Douro tinto. Classic Portuguese tinto. Slightly sweeter medium body Douro.

Cola nose, white pepper. All schist soil vineyards hence the name. Medium plus tannin, high acid, underripe dark fruit
Relatively rustic, with some shy black currant and blackberry flavors, complimented by black currant leaf, anise, tree bark, and coffee.

First time trying a Douro - and this one felt reminiscent of a zin/primitivo. Hardly anything on the nose. But once sipped I get notes of mushrooms and cherry. Very dry. Definitely earthy with some tannins. Preferred on the 2nd day once it opened up a bit. I’ll continue to seek out some more of this varietal for sure!

Take-away pizza wine after an eight hour drive back home from vacation. Great value Douro. Nice rich spicy nose. Full of clove, nutmeg, anise, sweet tobacco. On the palate juicy ripe dark fruit, blueberry, cherry, plum. Nice concentration, acidity and solid tannins. Good with pizza, would be better with a solid steak or beef stew!
3,8. Vrien nøtt å plukke blindt. Fikk muscadet-vibber, floral, litt aromatisk og ørlite fat og nøtt. Medium pluss på konsentrasjon, fint balansert. Godt laga, veldig bra til prisen

Xisto Illimitado 2019 van Luis Seabra. Dronk eerder al de witte bij @restaurantmaeve uit de selectie van @sommeljj. Deze is medium robijnrood van kleur. Lichte geur en sappige smaak met kersen, bosvruchten en een tikje boerenland. Slechts 12,5%. Vind ik mooi en netjes voor de warme Douro! 3.9/5 ⭐️

No visual é limpo e tem cor rubi de intensidade alta. No nariz é limpo e tem aromas de intensidade média + de ameixa, cereja, framboesa, groselha, alcaçuz, violeta, baunilha, carvalho, ervas, tabaco, defumado, chocolate e amora. Na boca é seco, encorpado, tânico, tem acidez elevada, acrescenta tostado, com final persistente. Nota 3,8.

Heel leuk glas van Seabra uit de Douro. Fris, sappig goede zuren, mooi geïntrigeerde tannines en slechts 12,5%. Kersen, cranberry, blauwe bessen, pruimen, laurier, leer en een klein beetje witte peper. Licht gekoeld gedronken.

Rubi intenso com lágrimas fartas! No nariz morango e frutas vermelhas, pouco intenso os voláteis! Na boca inicia bem ácido, mas elegante e saboroso ! Quando abre intensifica os taninos e equilibra-se! Final prolongado e também saboroso! Levou 4,1 esse portuga! Evoé 🍷🍷🍷🍷

Giallo dorato e buona consistenza. Il naso è di media intensità e buona complessità: spazia da una inconfondibile nota iodata e minerale alla pesca e ai fiori gialli, gelsomino e ginestra, con un tocco finale di resina. In bocca è morbido e caldo, caratteristiche sostenute da una sostenuta acidità e da una sapidità che rimane, allungando il sorso. Una bevuta inaspettata ed interessante. 87

4,25* Onverwacht fris rood en zwart fruit in de neus, beetje eik en wat mineraliteit. Medium mondgevoel met zachte textuur en verrassende zuren. Tannines  en afdronk ietwat warm en drogend als contrast met de initiële fruitigheid en fraicheur maar de balans is erg knap.

De color granate con buena capa y ribete rubí, limpio y brillante. En nariz de buena intensidad, aromas de frutas rojas maduras, cereza, piedra mojada y flores azules, violetas, finos tostados y especias, vainilla, pimienta, con final mineral. En boca es seco con buena acidez y fruta roja, especias, pimienta blanca, pizarra y aromas herbáceos, taninos pulidos, cuerpo medio, fresco y equilibrado, con final de buena persistencia.

Fruta tropical, ligeiramente adocicado contrastando com uma acidez salivante, é muito fresco. Vibrante, ligeiramente picante e tostado, muitíssimo bem equilibrado e com excelente textura. Maravilhoso, especialmente tendo em conta o preço bastante acessível.

Flavors of black cherry, bramble, chocolate, black licorice, brown sugar and licorice.

Medium smooth tannins, moderate acidity, silky smooth mouthfeel.  Fruit forward but not sweet. Good value.

Rating: 88-89
Very soft res wine with oke depth of flavour, some cherry and blackberry finished by some chocolate.
blackberry cherry red fruit red cherry
Quite a nice one, easy souplesse but not value for money: many others for much less.
Warm, peppery with balance. The tannin is there but slightly understated. A v good Douro red oak cherry pepper
plum earthy oak  cherry
Great with Steaks
Nice and fruity, memorable!
Tasty red, not too heavy! oak cherry
Nice full body. Notes if black berries. Leaves your mouth nice a dry at the end.
Prune, fruits murs et consistance.

3,9 stars. A very well made blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca & Tinto Cao by a great producer.

Perfumed nose of blueberry infused old liquorice in old ripe raspberry, green olive paste, canned-strawberry perfume, dried horse meat, birch bark, unsugared forest berry fruit tea, dash of apple cider, inky ripe wilting lilies flower petals, sweet clove & sweet anise.

Strawberry, vanilla, leather - definitely fruit forward and drinkable. Would pair well with pizza or a pasta with meat sauce. Like a montepulciano but less sweet.
A medium dry Douro with an off sweet start, medium tannins, sweet cherry. Aligns with grapes once meant for port.
Excellent type one. A dark sight for a 2015 wine that taste tenuous around the soft tannin. And 14 months in French oak barrel. Applause!
Absolutely stunning. Pepper, spiciness, rich floral notes on the palate. Deep and smooth finish. Delicious
One of my favorite from Douro, smooth and easy drinking, leather, tobacco and chocolate, balanced acidity and tannins that finishes with little minerality aftertaste. 😊🍷🍷

Sweet red, dark in colour, medium body. Cherry, plum, a little oak
This is great stuff. Red meat please!

Very dry, but deep
and tasty. Really mineral white with a hint of citrus.

Nose- raspberry, strawberry, ripe red fruit
Taste- medium body, ripe red fruit, super light tannins, raspberry, very gsm-like
So classic, pleasant and balanced.

A very smooth round intense Douro tinto, surprisingly soft tannins vanilla oak and some plum with a long pleasent taste of dark berries . Easy to drink I will buy more and also test the little more expensive wine from same winery!

Wines of Portugal tasting meeting conducted by Alexandre Lalas at ABS-Rio.
Nice rubi red color.
Not intense red and black fruit aromas with notes of coffee, leather and minerals.
Medium-bodied (13%), not completely well-balanced Douro wine due to some excess acidity, with nice alcohol and soft, rounded tannins. Aftertaste is strong, slightly rough and persistent, leaving a full-mouth sensation.
An 84-GB pts wine.
The nose is cherry with a hints of cinnamon. The flavors are cassis and red plum with overtones of blood orange. The aftertaste has a chocolate and burnt sugar component.

A blend of 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Touriga Franca, 20% Tinta Roriz and 10% Tinto Cão from Douro, Portugal. Earthy and fruit-driven, deep, round, with silky tannins. Opens with notes of blueberry, vanilla, blackberry, chocolate, violet, graphite, cedar and a hint of pepper. Stylish and well made.
Christian Seely and Antonio Agrellos constructed a new winery at Romaneira in 2005 starting from scratch, to realize their dream.

Wine South America. Bento Gonçalves. Medium ruby color with violaceous tons. Cherries jam, blackberry and jasmine flowers at nose. Very smooth and highly structured with a long and fruited final. 100% touriga nacional from Douro region.
a rusty brown colour. a bouquet of blackcurrant balsamic and astringent hairspray a smooth wine with a hint of strawberries a short finish sweet
Surprisingly not a bad red wine from Portugal which is famous for its Ports. Round and soft on tannins. Easy drink for a Monday night dinner.
Great wine! 👁 dark ruby red color. 👃 oak, chocolate, dark fruit and plum. 👅 bold and straightforward. Medium-long aftertaste.
Red meat, beef on the nose! Strong aromatic wine. Fruity in mouth, nice, drinkable, first experiences with Portugal red... 😃
Dry and acrid, old world leather and dark shaded black fruit.   Tannic and tart with a mod finish…

Nice one from Duoro again. Tasted same vintage two months ago. 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Touriga Francesa, 20% Tinta Roriz, 10% Tinto Cao.Fermented at stainless steel tank for 7 days. Aged 11 months at wooden barrel. 

Medium purple with pink edge. 

Rose petal, cherry, jam, and hint of mint and pepper. 

Round medium tannic taste with medium+ acidic. A bit sweet. 

Acidic attack. Soft texture. Long bitter finish.

Investing in quality really pays off in the bottle.
Chocolate,  oak, tobacco,  black fruit, very good complexity and flavour intensity,  with a medium(+) finish.
Great Douro dry red. Lovely dark fruit with soft tannins. V good acidity. Short caudalies though. Fruity and oaky with dense surface. Great entry point
Very nice Douro red. 12,5% but with great body and length. Acidity is there to make it a 20+ yr wine. Blackfruuts, some cinnamon and green feel that requires some air
Agree on the value point. Almost blueberry like, cherry and... Chocolate (modest portion) it doesn't have a huge character(13%alcohol) but pleasant to drink.
Nice black and red fruit forwardness to this red with pepper spices, some vanilla and blackberry cobbler cola. Yum. From Douro, tried while at Graham’s in Porto.

A fascinating wine. On the initial taste, it reminds of Blackjack and Fruit Salad sweets... A real richness. Later there is aniseed and tobacco with good oak and nice acidity. The aftertaste is more fruit dominated with blackberry, raspberry and plum.
Good Tinto! Blackcurrant and cherry in the nose. A lot of chocolate on the palate.
Another nice Douro for a very good price. Balanced with notes of chocolate and pepper.
Uninteresting but pleasant and clean.

Ótimo vinho! Equilibrado com bons aromas e corpo médio.
Surpreendeu! Um bom vinho do Douro para a lista dos preferidos!
Ótimo vinho do Douro, promoção Spm São Roque, valeu a pena.🍷🍷
Vinho extremamente saboroso, boa acidez e taninos muito presentes.
Um Douro com carácter, que requer um petisco a condizer.
Sou suspeito: amo vinhos portugueses. Que beleza esse Romaneira. Elegante, equilibrado, aromático. Um típico do Douro. Final de boca longo e agradável. Taninos bem amaciados.

Отличное вино,понравилось.Нос дуб,красные фрукты,гранат,черешня.
Во вкусе Дуб,черешня и ваниль.Полнотелое,отлично структурированное,кислотность в норме.Однозначно рекомендую !
Cor rubi intensa; aromas potentes de frutas vermelhas maduras, compota, tabaco, especiarias e chocolate; na boca encorpado, sedoso, macio, taninos elegantes, pimenta negra, final longo. Muito bom!
Fresco e muito elegante. As notas frutadas ainda permanecem, especiarias, floral, couro e mineral. Harmônico, de presença levemente picante na boca, final longo e muito agradável.

O melhor Douro que degustei nos últimos 12 meses. 
Frutas vermelhas maduras, cerejas, com final entre pimenta e chocolate. 
Corpo médio, com final médio. Acidez, tanino e álcool equilibrados.
Que robusto e marcante. Notas aromáticas de cereja e um toque anis. No palato grande destaque pra baunilha e carvalho. Belo preço qualidade. Coloração vermelho rubi intenso. EZ 90.

Um português frutado, de médio corpo, com taninos presentes e longa persistência em boca.

Frutas maduras vermelhas, como ameixa e amora, ao final percebe-se leve toque amadeirado.
Uvas tradicionais e um vinho muito elegante, macio, bem equilibrado, aroma de cerejas em compota, baunilha, Carvalho e canela, leve toque de tabaco e final persistente com fresco de menta. Muito bom.
Cor violeta escura. Nariz complexo com fruta madura suave e barrica. Corpo cheio, equilibrado, redondo. Tudo bem envolvido. Final longo. Belo par de vinhos partilhado com o meu amigo rocha!🍷🍷
Os 13% de volume alcoólico poderá levar a pensar mal deste vinho. É puro engano. Cheio, saboroso, equilibrado e, neste caso, apesar de já ter uns anos portou-se lindamente.
Um blend que traz dosagem ideal da touringa nacional notas de frutas secas presentes e intensa , coloração forte , pouco tanino , um jovem que sabe ser elegante ! Volia !
Boa acidez, equilibrado, facil de beber, aromas de café e frutas vermelhas maduras. Persistente. Bom vinho
Belo portuga, frutas negras maduras equilibrado, harmonico, final médio, tostados e leve compota de figo. Recomendo.

Niesamowite! Dostojne, bogate i powalająco harmonijne. Ma wszystko, wiśnie czereśnie,  śliwki, kandyzowane owoce, wanilie, kakao... i to wszystko pięknie sie łączy dając genialny efekt. 
PT ❤

Entrada de gama da Romaneira.
Não é eloquente, e nem era esperado.
Cor rubi pálida.
Agradável no nariz mas a necessitar de mais intensidade e estrutura na boca.
Para entrada está muito bom.
Fot trampad. Ca 12 Euro. No tannins.
Tremendo! Me encantan los vinos de esta zona de Portugal. Nos lo tomamos para celebrar el cumple de mi mujer. La noche acabó bien, así que doy gracias a este vino

Um belo vinho português do Douro.

Visual: tinto, límpido, brilhante, vermelho rubi, tranquilo 

Nariz: Franco, fragrante, frutas vermelhas maduras

Boca: corpo médio +, frutas vermelhas maduras, madeira, especiarias, final médio. Bom equilíbrio e taninos

Mais um grande vinho português! Aromas e sabores típicos das uvas portuguesas, que encantam e abrilhantam qualquer refeição. Com um custo-benefício incrível na promoção da Wine. Além da bela garrafa que guardarei de recordação.

De cor rubi fechada, tem tons puxados para o púrpura. O aroma predominante no meu olfato é o de grama molhada, o sabor ficou entre o amadeirado e frutado e os taninos bem equilibrados. Muito bom! Santé! 🍷

2a safra deste vinho muito bom duriense. Vermelho rubi profundo com halo granada. Aromas de frutas negras maduras, especiarias apimentadas, couro, tostado e tabaco. Taninos gastronômicos e final longo. Nota 4,0.

Черешня, вишнёвый ликёр, дуб, орехи, горелая пластмасса(чуть-чуть), тёрн. Довольно среднее по телу и структуре, но с очень красивым ягодно-пряным финишем. Красивая Португалия, линейка выше как must have. 3.9

Belíssimo exemplar português, que foi um sucesso no evento. Apresentando cor vermelho escuro, com aroma de frutas vermelhas e pretas, destacando-se cereja, morango , amora e ameixa. Corpo, equilíbrio e acidez médios. Final gostoso, bem frutado, e macio.

Um vinho curioso que veio com o nome sino e a garrafa de 500ml. Só por ai já despertava nosso interesse. No mais, um vinbo maduro, com pouca madeira, frutas negas e um toque de pimenta. Embalou strogonofg de frango nos Roma

Safra 2011 vinho de um rubi intenso com lágrima muito lentas no nariz notas de frutas secas, couro, baunilha, caixa de charuto, e leve toque de especiarias! Na boca extremamente equilibrado! Taninos domados, com um final longo é extremamente prazeiroso! Um vinho português ótimo!!!!
Saúde amigos do Vivino

E a vida é assim. Quando eu já achava que depois do Quinta da Romaneira Syrah e do Crochet nada mais haveria de interessante, eis que surge este Sino da Romaneira, um blend tinto de altíssima qualidade e muita elegância. Outro vinho top desfrutado durante o Essência do Vinho da última quinta-feira. Saúde!

Cor rubi bastante charmosa. Aromas e paladar bastante aveludados. O que mais chama atenção é na boca a sensação de ser bem macio,aveludado.. Paladar de frutas maduras com um leve toque de madeira. Taninos muito bem equilibrados. Ótima pedida !

Muito bom. Vinícola Quinta da Romaneira possui vinhos de boa qualidade, e este é um deles. Frutado, aroma groselha, acidez equilibrada, taninos macios. É um vinho fácil de beber, mas possui complexidade. Acompanhou risoto de camarão e salmão assado, com louvor. (4.1)

Almoço de sexta feira.  No menu,  cabrito.  Esse Douro 2011 (essa safra é uma pedida de segurança) acompanhou muito bem o prato. Taninos macios. Final elegante. Um bom corpo apesar de apenas 13% (segundo o rótulo) de teor alcoólico.

Blend portuga do Douro, mescla das castas Tintas Roriz e Cão e Tourigas Nacional e França! No nariz, frutado, com notas de especiarias e pimenta! Em boca, corpo mediano e equilíbrio em geral! Bom custo-benefício!

12,5%. Visual violeta fraco com reflexos rubis, lagrimas longas, límpido , brilhante. No nariz parecia um pouco alcoólico porem após 10 minutos abrem-se aromas de ameixa madura e em calda , notas de baunilha , um toque de canela e um café enebriante. Na boca acidez modesta, taninos aveludados e sedosos, redondo, doce na medida, final longo com retrogosto intenso de café espresso, por esse detalhe eu aprovo humildemente! Salve o solo xistoso deste Terroir!

Ótimo blend dessa grande vinicula. Um vinho agradavel, equilibrado, com final intenso e marcante , sem ser forte, com taninos maduros, acidez controlada e álcool sobre controle, mesmo com pouco tempo de decanter, um vinho de segurança por um bom custo, como alguns outros portugueses nessa faixa de preço, só para citar alguns o cartuxa colheita, o crasto superior e o esporão reserva .

Mais  bom vinho degustado no evento Porto|Douro. Este é elaborado com as castas Touriga Nacional, Franca, Tinta Roriz e Tinto Cão e passou por 14 meses em barricas de carvalho francês.
Visual rubi de fundo negro.
Os aromas puxaram de início especiarias, pimenta e alecrim, um pouco de madeira, caramelo e fundo floral.
Em geral, o vinho é muito bem equilibrado, possui paladar saboroso, com Taninos macios e longo final.

Um ótimo português em uma das suas melhores safras. Coloração violacea; odor de frutas negras com intensidade menor e predominância das notas secundárias (tabaco, couro e chocolate meio amargo). Na boca agradável complexo com taninos finos e final persistente. Gosto especial pela vitoria do Atlético Paranaense sobre o SP na Copa do Brasil.

The wine is really pleasant, very elegant, easy-to-drink and offers a superb value for money!
Cette cuvée est particulièrement bien réussie avec son nez expressif où se profilent des arômes de fruits des champs, de prune, de poivre noir et de graphite, rehaussés de notes florales et épicées.
90/100. Mon appréciation sur www.fidelesdebacchus.com

Um Sino da Romaneira, do Douro, muito elegante, frutas na boca de se babar.
Maravilhoso. Um Douro, amaciado, suave, maravilhas de Portugal, daquele lindo lugar. Sempre inesquecível para se ver, e nunca se esquecer com o sabor e paladar  mágico daquelas paisagens.

Saúde!!!!!

Cor: Rubi vivo
Aromas: Frutas vermelhas e negras maduras ameixa e cereja, especiarias pimenta preta e cravo, mineral, cedro, defumado, bacon e flor violeta.
Paladar: Seco, encorpado, acidez equilibrada com o bom corpo, camadas de frutas maduras sobre a lingua, taninos macios e sedosos, final de boca longo.
Harmonização: Carnes vermelhas, caça, bacalhau, risoto de osso buco, queijos de massa meia cura e curados.
Muito bom este representante do Douro na taça.

92 pontos. Aromas delicados e frutados. Bom corpo, pouca potência, muitíssimo equilibrado. Taninos perfeitos, como se tivessem sido esculpidos por um artesão. Com alguns minutos se expande mostrando um pequeno aumento na potência e boa complexidade.

Vinho que agradou aos paladares femininos. Muito redondinho e com preço incrível para o que oferece: R$ 78
Ameixa fresca.
Corpo e persistência médios.
Taninos macios.
O Quinta me agrada mais, mas vale muito a pena pelo seu valor.

Bom corpo. Excelente acompanhamento num jantar ou almoço bem reconfortante que pode ir de algo mais distinto, a uma mão de vaca com grão. Um vinho que nos enche a boca e nos deixa feliz na relação qualidade, preço

Corte de tinta roriz, touriga nacional,touriga franca e tinto cão com aromas de frutas maduras e especiarias doces. Na boca suave com meio de boca maduro, aveludado e com bom corpo! Final  médio e balsâmico! Bom vinho

3.9
Vinho muito equilibrado em todas as suas componentes. 
Forte intensidade aromática com fruta vermelha madura muito bem integrada com a madeira. Penso que será mesmo o  ponto mais forte neste vinho. 
Na boca mantém o registo de equilíbrio e elegância  com um corpo e persistência média. 
Teor alcoólico surpreendente de 13% vindo do Alto Douro e ainda bem. 

Está num momento óptimo de consumo.

3,8 Ótimo vinho.
Floral e ligeiramente picante, a lembrar pimenta preta e pétalas de rosa, características das grandes castas do Douro, Touriga e Tinta Roriz. Equilibrado e suave, este vinho revela frescura e apresenta um fim bastante harmonioso.

Parece que de alguma forma o Douro traz o brilho do sol e luz até nós...este Sino bateu forte em meu jantar mediterrâneo aproximando o delicado paladar com a harmonia das castas portuguesas. Equilibrado, redondo, aveludado com um gosto final de quero abrir a próxima garrafa. Celebramos um momento único.

Excelente vinho. A primeira  sensação ao sair da garrafa é a sua intensidade. De cor escura e muito fechado. Após respirar na taça, seus aromas começam a despertar pouco a pouco e tornam-se cada vez mais ricos e complexos. Taninos equilibrados, seco e intenso.

Vinho 1/19 Encontro enogastronomico Casa Sagres. O melhor vinho da noite, merece os 88 pontos, só faltou respirar mais, tomado diretamente da garrafa estava bem fechado. Coloração rubi intensa, com muita madeira no nariz e boca, alguma fruta negra no fim, mas para isso faltou respirar. Harmonizou com uma porcheta.

Um vinho muito honesto, com uma ótima qualidade de fruta e boa relação cxb. A garrafa de 500ml é uma graça.
Instagram: @harmonizacom

Sempre muito.justo esse vinho da Romaneira.traz um custo bem acessível pela qualidade q traz.
Um vinho redondo e estruturado.
Возможно когда я добрался до него, оно уже начало того... На вкус показалось ровным, немного плоское, при этом аромат пьянил интересным букетом
Un beau fruit, une belle puissance. Simple mais pas simpliste. Exactement le vin dont j'avais envie (/besoin?) ! Moment très sympa.
Odeur fruit confit gout fruit rouge bonne acidite qui amène un équilibre malgre un cote capiteux. Plus digeste que beaucoup vins de cette région
Bouquet d frutas vermelhas, tabaco e cacau. Corpo médio, álcool pronunciado e taninos poderosos. Bom final d boca com boa persistência.🍷🍷
Ótimo blend do Douro! Aromas de frutas negras maduras, notas de tabaco. Corpo médio, taninos de boa qualidade, boa acidez e álcool equilibrado.
3.7 Safra 2013. Vinho bem aromático, equilibrado, notas de jabuticaba madura, taninos macios, boa acidez, corpo médio. Bom vinho 🇵🇹.

Um vinho tranquilo!
No nariz um pouco fechado, nem sequer foi decantado..
Na boca foi macio e ainda com capacidade para mais anos..
Excelente vinho português do Doro, fácil de beber, taninos bem suaves, rubi intenso e bem encorpado, acidez baixa... Valeu!!!
Vinho mt elegante. Taninos equilibrados. Final suave. Excelente vinho português. Quem tiver oportunidade, deguste. Não irão se arrepender.
Passou 14 meses em barricas de carvalho frances de 2nd uso. Equilibrado, com poucos taninoa, paladar leve e aroma amadeirado.
Um legítimo Douro com aromas de cereja, tabaco e no final uma baunilha. Bem equilibrado com taninos potentes e retrogosto médio.
De cor rubi intensa, bastante aromático, persistente na boca, frutas negras e um pouco de fumaça ao fundo, acidez um pouco acima ...

Bem frutado, ameixa preta predomina. Um pouco de framboesa e Carvalho ao fim. O sabor foi maravilhoso, o cheiro não tão marcante! 
Ótima surpresa para nosso aniversário de 4 anos de namoro.

Confraria BigDog, toda terça belos testes cegos. Portuga fino e acessível. Notas de frutas vermelhas frescas, baunilha, canela, terra, florais. A madeira em equilíbrio bem de leve já indicava ser português. Na boca é bem polido e elegante, mantendo a classe e fineza em toda extensão persistindo legal. 3.8

BigDog Wine friends. Always a nice blind tasting. Fresh red berries, vanilla, cinammon, earth, flowers. Balanced and light oak shows It's from Portugal. Polished and elegant, it keeps class in all lenght.
Frutado, ameixa. Bom vinho, leve, aveludado.
Hoje a noite vai ser longa....
Suave, ligeiro, fresco, deixa a boca fresca. Ficamos com um sabor a amoras vermelhas.
Oleoso, redondo. Muito agradável.

Muito bom! Ficou aberto 5hrs
O alcool esta levemente presente,mas depois de um tempo,ficou bem equilibrado
Esta no limite. Nao evoluira mais
Safra que conheci minha esposa para comemorarmos 8 anos juntos

2011 o ano de Portugal.  Gosto muito desse vinho. De cor rubi amora.  Com uma lágrima bonita.  Um bouquet muito presente de tabaco e especiarias e anis.  Frutados intensos.  Na boca frutas maduras uma acidez média presença da barrica de Carvalho, tabaco, especiarias, picantes.  Taninos macios que duram na boca.  Com final longo.
Delicioso vinho... Frutas vermelhas bem presente
Muito bom. Boa harmonização com ragu de javali.

Safra 2011, limpo com cor ligeiramente acastanhada, presença de lágrimas com textura, aroma a frutos vermelhos maduros, madeira, encorpado, acidez média, com presença de taninos maduros e final médio.
Maravilhoso!!! Muito equilibrado, floral, elegante
Bem mineral e ácido, toque leve de abacaxi
Bom vinho, faltou um pouco de adstringência para uma belíssima moqueca...
Черноперечный привет от прекрасной долины Дору. Мягкие танины, фрукты; вино красиво живет во рту.
Vermelho rubi. Madeira, groselha, chocolate e baunilha. Bem razoável.
Taninos macios, agradável ao beber
Que pedaço de boa saúde!
Um ótimo Douro. Bem aromático, com chocolate e frutas vermelhas . Bom corpo. Bons taninos. Boa persistência. Vale!
Vinho com boa potência, adstringência bem equilibrada, frutas vermelhas, combina muito bem com bisteca suína.
Klassischer Douro - zu Beginn eher verhalten, nach zwei Stunden ein toller Essensbegleiter - also rechtzeitig Öffnen.
Sem palavras.
Leve, gostoso ... Harmonizou muito bem com purê de batata com paleta de porco e molho de hibiscos
Depois de uma hora no decanter começou a se ajeitar, porém ja está com coloração atijolada.
Bom corpo e acidez,  bem gastronômico.
Um clássico do Douro a preço convidativo! Quinta da Romaneira um vinho suave com taninos macios.

Rubi  intenso,  muito frutado .
Deixar decantar 30 min.
Gostei.
Groselha, madeira. Bom corpo.  Retrogosto médio.
Bom, cor rubi, ameixas e pimenta...
Fresco de cuerpo medio bajo, retronasal complejo
Vinho simples, que não compromete no dia a dia.
Bom vinho. Taninos um pouco agressivos e demorou um pouco para abri. Bom para o dia a dia.
Vinho de aroma agradável e refrescante, melhorou como passar do tempo!
Vinho ok! Bom custo benefício (não foi o valor do Vivino que paguei , meu Deus)!
Une attaque sur les fruits noirs confiturés, une évolution épicé. Une agréable découverte.
Vinho fácil, polido e fresco. Bom para a mesa.
Vinho honesto pelo preço.
Bom vinho. Interessante decantar por uns 20 a 30 minutos.

Empieza con sabor dulce y acaba con el sabor un poco amargo y fuerte. Variedad de sabor en un trago
Einfacher Douro Erin, aber sehr bekömmlich, keine Überreife

Just arrived in Portugal.  Great wine to start the visit. Smooth with oak, vanilla, and dark chocolate notes throughout.  It starts a little juicy and gets just a touch more dry through the finish.

Seven varieties: Aragonez, Trincadeira, Syrah, Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Cabernet Sauvignon, Alicante Bouschet. 12 mooin oak (French, American 60:40). Deep ruby. Clean, medium plus intensity aroma of black fruit, coffee, tobacco, earth and orange peel. Dry, medium plus acidity, medium plus ripe tannins, high alcohol, full body and medium plus finish. Palate confirms the nose. Intense, bold, complex. WOP.

Smooth and balanced. Medium to full-bodied, medium tannins and acidity. Stone, leather, plum, cranberry and cherry on the nose. Palate: vanilla, plum, cherry, earthy, pepper. Long and smooth finish. Requires some time to oxidate after opening.
Nice wine from Alentejo Portugal, smooth, fruit forward!
Vinho bastante regular entre as safras, frutas vermelhas, baunilha, chocolate, acidez boa, taninos maduros, encorpado, final longo
Makes me want to put my dancing shoes on
Delicious Portuguese red wine multiple grapes from Ajentejo region. Nice red fruit with great firm tannins and a long smooth finish
plum oak vanilla sour cherry leather Nice with lamb chops
Red berries, jams, a little pepper. Vanilla. The tannins are tenacious. Acidity is high. Good, but the alcohol is slightly perceptible in the aftertaste.

Becoming a bit of a standard at dinner evenings as quite good and reasonably priced

A red fruit nose

Raspberry, strawberry and cherry
Some oak and stone

Cheers all
Tastes of dark plums and apricots. Blueberries lace the palate during the second phase. Portuguese wine is underrated. Having this with my love, Evita in A windmill in the Algarve of Portugal ❤️
New vintage but still a great bottle and always pick it up from Costco. A little hint of both black fruit and red fruit with a slight vanilla notes and maybe a white pepper finish .

Time to end Portugal stay - all good things come to an end after all. Esporao is a good way to do so. This 2020 has a wonderful label. Still young and will improve over time. It’s a pretty constant wine - good tannins, oak, chocolate, nice cherry traits, even a bit of a coffee aftertaste. Adeus Portugal 🇵🇹!

Found at Costco for a great price ($20) and gave it a try. Portuguese wine is hard to come by and I haven’t found many since visiting there. This was a pleasant surprise. Buy again if lucky enough to find it again

Good wine, dark ruby of color, full-bodied. On the nose aromas of wild berries, blackberries, blueberries and licorice, hints of cocoa and spices. In the mouth it’s dry, flavors of black fruits, blackberries, notes of  coffee, chocolate, spices and a slight toast from the barrel. Well-structured, with a long and persistent finish.

The youngest Esporão Reserva I've ever tasted. Chosen for today's ⚽️🥅 World Cup game between Portugal and Morocco. Very dark ruby colour with very fresh aromas of berries of different colours. Blueberry, blackberry, raspberry with nuances of vanilla, oak, pepper, licorice and a whiff of chocolate. On the palate medium(+)bodied with high acidity and not yet fully polished tannins. Juicy flavours of earthy strawberry, blackcurrant, cherry with notes of pepper, oak, coffee with chocolate. Medium aftertaste, fruity 🏁

Great fruity, very perfumed, and pretty complex wine. Notes of blueberry, strawberry, black cherry compote, with some dark chocolate and pepper spice, and some violet and fresh tobacco leaf notes. Mild well-used oak shows through a subtle vanilla hints. Velvety medium tannins, high acidity, medium(+) body and a medium(+) finish.

Didn’t disappoint. Lots of black fruit on the nose, BlackBerry, plum, blueberry. Taste was fruit forward with the aforementioned, with the tannins and boldness to follow of oak and a little leather. Softer finish of vanilla. Finish wasn’t overly long but overall a pleasant red wine.

And the best red of the night during a great party. No detailed notes.
Balanced and elegant with a lingering finish.
Excellent with dark fruit and red fruit with good tannins and a touch of leather at the finish
Tannic, full bodied. Blackberry, plum, vanilla.
A bit rough, but good for bio alentejano!
MM enjoyed.  Would buy if able
Yummy. Super smooth. Goes with everything
Dark chocolate and very oaky. Good depth but a touch on the dry side.
Cherry, black pepper, Stong tannins, nice acidity, dark dark! Chocolate,
Vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate, with character
Lovely rich nose. Red fruit, plum, brambles. Supple tannins.
90/100. Allways good through the years. Cheers

Medium-bodied, fruity, berries and cherries, a bit juicy with a touch of sweetness.  A bit acidic with taming, drying tannins.  A bit young, even after one hour aeration, still a bit aggressive, not complex, but still pleasant to drink, much better with food.  I began drinking it before dinner, with spaghetti and a nice garlicky sauce with smoked Italian sausage, things got much better.  The 2019 I had a couple months ago tells me this will get better in 8 months or so.  Overall good, okay at $16.49.

Pleasant. Dark purple color. Slightly spicy savory blackberry prune nose.  Palate has much of the same with cinnamon and tobacco leaf. Short dry finish. Decent but not a stunner. This was fine as a late night drinker with sourdough bread oil and balsamic vinegar.

Deep ruby. Aromas of oak, lots of ripe black fruit and fresh red fruit, with hints of pepper. Not much more complexity in the nose, but pleasant high intensity aromas. In the mouth, full bodied, medium-high stromg tannins, medium-high acidity, a strange vegetal aftertaste that fades a bit with time.

Review: Deep red with aromas of dark berries licorice a bit of cocoa black pepper and spices. 
In the mouth is full body rich and complex, again black fruit and spices well-integrated tannins and acidity and a long finish. Needs decanter today and will evolve for at least more 6 to 8 years for sure. 3,9 now
So much berry and cherry to mouth. Amazing!
Vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate, with character!
Wasn’t as outstanding as I had it in mind
Too young to be drunk
Nice, not great, full body, vainilla, chocolate, red fruit, strong tannins, no much complexity.
Smooth and elegant, plenty of flavour, full and powerful. All in all, a classy vino.
Perfect wine, it’s not old, but tastes like old wine. Imagine how it’ll be tasted in a 10 years.
Medium body, great finish.
Full bodied and amazing
Had at Rachel’s house
Very pleasant and balanced wine, for an informal meal.
Ooo, nice wine...without words
Full body and nice balance
Smooth wine, nice finish. Had this wine in a restaurant in Porto.
oak black fruit cherry vanilla

An absolute classic of 🇵🇹 wine that I had never tried, thought it was the time and place to do so, even if this is easy to find back home too 😊

From an estate founded in 1267(!), organic blend of Aragonez (Tempranillo), Trincadeira, CabSav and Alicante Bouschet. 20yo vines. 12m in oak. 

Deep dark red.
Cigar, dark chocolate, vanilla, smoke, liquorice, balsamic, prune, cooked dark cherry, blueberry, violet, incense. Perfumed and complex.
Fullb, bright acid and m+ spicy super fine tannins.

➡️➡️➡️
Oaky black fruit

Dark red in colour.
A rather heavy aroma with dark, ripe berries. 
Fruit compote (fig) in mouth but well balanced with distinguished tannins, oak and a hint of vanilla. This wine needs a good piece of meat.

Found this rare treasure which I forgot about in an old cellar. Great deep red almost brown color with fantastic tearing.  Bouquet of spice, wood, summer berries, cinnamon and anise. Taste wise there is some mineral, summer fruits, sour cherry and a nice dry finish that makes this red pair well with game, strong cheese and red meats.

Deep purple red color and a lot of glycerine. In the nose woody, ripe blackberry fruits and nice spicy nuances. On the palette good structured tannins and full jammy fruit. Long finish. A wine to enjoy with some steak or just like that. Keeps easily 10y

Took this 1991 Esporão Reserva out from the cellar and into a night with friends and petiscos - and what a beautiful surprise. Although I felt it was a couple of years past its prime, loved the balance and complexity - on the nose, all balsamic, earthy, cigar box and some toffee, tawny-like notes. On the palate, dry with extremely silky tannins, medium acidity and an enveloping profile of secondary flavors. Was not a consensual wine, but it truly made my evening - 4.2⭐️

It needs some time to open, but then it’s great! Dark ruby color and intensely aromatic: cherry jelly, balsamic notes, cedar, spices (nutmeg and sandalwood), chocolate, mint, resins and flowers. Medium body, very fine tannins, a good astringency and still very well balanced. An aftertaste of jellies, sandalwood, spices, resins and chocolate. A long lasting finish. Wonderful!

4 blend (Cab Sauv, Aragonez, Alicante Bouschet, Trincadeira) red from Alentejo aged 12 mos in French and American oak. Beautifully blended for harmonious ,lush offering, and intense ruby/purple colour. Deep dark fruit nose, with sage and vanilla hints. Black currents and ripe dark fruit in palate. Grippy tannins and high acid. Long finish. Recommended!! 🇵🇹🇵🇹 Paired perfectly with traditional Portuguese/Brazilian Bacalhao Gomes da sa.

Deep dark almost blackish color in the glass.
Blackberry and other dark berries, together with oak, iron and cassis.
Medium body, acidity and medium to low tannins.
To summarize, a very elegant and well-structured Esporão Red with nice depth. (4.3)

Dark ruby ​​color in the aroma and taste above all dark fruit in the background ripe red fruit notes oak chocolate vanilla tobacco coffee earthy leather smoke mushrooms cinnamon pepper licorice well balanced medium acidity pleasant delicate tannin good wine solo.  🍇🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻⭐️

It was a long and tasty night. My daughter had a birthday and we tried with couple of friends to taste and later in the evening to finish couple of good wines.
Taste # 1 - 🇵🇹 
Very silky and smooth Alentejo. Soft tannins, very drinkable. Ripe fruit in the mouth. Excellent finish. Actually it was a very good start of the evening.

Deep purple colour. Gorgeous floral bouquet of plum, vanilla, leather, and cherry. Layered palate of plum, dark berries, leather, and tobacco. Medium bodied with light, well mannered tannins. Medium length finish of cherries accompanied by mellow tannic astringency. Moderate price and excellent value.

Paired well with Peranakan food which has spices and full of favours. Full bodied and yet not over powering with combination of different grape types in balance. Quite a good recommendation by the owner of the restaurant.

Well balanced with some oak, wood, slate, earthiness. Cherry on the nose. Black fruit. Paired with sweet red sauce pizza but would be better with beef. Or something with a bit of a kick. Like bbq! Yummy.

Full on Portugese quality stuff from alentejo wine region close to Algarve. Matured in French and American oak for 12 months which is very noticeable. Cab sav blended with indigenous grapes like aragonez, trincadeira and Alicante bouschet. Enjoyed with grilled steak under a summer starry night sky - perfect!

Good wine to get me ready for a trip to Douro Valley this week!  This wine is fairly big and bold. Good balance of fruit and tannins. Very jammy. Can't wait to see what else Douro has in store for me and my friends.

Dark ruby colour, this wine is a wonderfull blend, with aromas of cherries and wild berries, violets and caramel from the beautifully blended oak, taste is as good as the aroma, with a good vannilla and some medium strong tannins, great medium acidity and some tastes of elegante jams, it is trully a mastery of portuguese wine. And a medium finish.

Yellow golden, clean and shine. Aroma of lemon and rich of sweet yellow fruit, peach. In the mouth mature pineapple, medium plus acidity, medium plus body, medium end. Beautiful wine.     Amarelo dourado, limpo e brilhante. Aroma de limão e rico de fruta amarela doce, pêssego. Na boca abacaxi maduro, acidez média alta, corpo médio alto, final médio. Belo vinho.

Some unfamiliar cultivars to me but what a great gift from my Portuguese friend.  
Low well balanced tannins. Berries, spices and tobacco on the nose.  
Lovely complex berries, plum and vanilla on the palate.
Highly recommended.
Saúde!

We liked this Portuguese wine at a tasting and bought a bottle over our normal budget, saving it for our wedding anniversary. It's a medium bodied wine, with well balanced tannins and lots of dark fruit. We didn't know the varietals but they reminded us of Grenache. A firm, strong wine.

You'll notice amazing, delicious baking spice on nose blending with ripe fruits - red and dark. Very light oak present. Same on palate. Slightly dry finish and extremely well blended. This is priced nicely.

4.1. One of the first wines, I brought home from Portugal. Delicious Alentejo classic just entering its optimal drinking window. Full spectrum Aromas of strawberry, cassis, blackberry, dark cherry, plum, figs and raisins followed by nice notes of barbecue, mint, chocolate and vanilla. Good use of oak. Finish shows some additional graphite and med plus length.

Intense blackberry aroma and taste. Cherry, leather, cedar.

Smooth, almost no tannins. High on the acidity. Extremely berry driven.
Some vanilla. Black full. Full and round. Will grow softer in tannines. With Jeroen Ijzerman at Montemar in Cascais Portugal.
Really a great try. Heavy. I really enjoyed. Had a few glasses with lasagna. Paired pretty well. Cherry and oak but not overpowering.

90pts.

VivinoVancouver crew blind tasting in Whistler. 17/20 bottles served blind over the weekend. No formal notes were recorded.
Smoke and slightly fermented berries in the nose. A bit buttery palate, prominent cherry, oak, vanilla, pointy, fresh, but not thin.
Highly concentrated. Plum, black berries, leather, oak. Still very vibrant with quite high tanins.
Smooth and robust. Nothing exceptional but you can’t go wrong with this one. Maybe too young?

Aromas of red fruit, vanilla and wood.  Dry, acidic and tannic.
Lovely nose: cognac, vanilla, and musk.  Medium weight on the palette and lingers.

What a wonderful wine. Spicy, oak, leather.

Eucalyptus, dry and very tasty. Goes well with tuna tataki (sesame and pepper)

Full bodied, long finish on the nose. Notes of  ripe plums. Good to drink.

Full bodied medium acid medium to strong tannins. Full of red fruits, plenty of oak and vanilla

It’s still very good. But the 2012, 13 and 14 were even better.
Rich, vibrant nose. Black raspberry and a bit of smokiness behind that. Better a few days in
Vanilla dark fruit and chocolate made all the better being enjoyed in a great restaurant in Porto, Portugal
You need to wait long after opening the bottle for the wine to lose its sharp taste. After that the wine is super smooth.
Beautiful complex aromas. Notes of plum, cherry, chocolate and vanilla. Let it breathe for awhile. Very tasty!

Dry wine with cherry, blackcurrant, plum, earthy, charred wood aromas, high tannin, full body, well balanced. Very nice.
One of the best wines I had the privillege to taste! So intense, full-bodied, fruity, intoxicating 😀

4.1/5
Outstanding Alentejano with a remarkable bouquet of dark fruit, vanilla, cherries and some gentle oaky finish.
Delicious leather, oak and chocolate flavours. Deep and rich - perfect with a moonlit dinner in Portugal!
Portuguese surprise! Full body, dark fruit, oak, dry, and young & fresh. Bought it is a surprise and like it
Needs some time to open up. Oak, dark fruits, firm tannins that were tempered with time exposed to the air.
Beautiful red from Portugal with deep, dark tones that pair well with beef and lamb. Hits way above the price point. Love it.
White pepper, vanilla, light oak, blackberry, black currant, high acidity, medium dry finish and gentle tannins.
Nice red wine, full bodied, not too acidic with deep fruit flavor and notes of oak and leather, good price.
Very nice wine. Full of red berries in mouth and nose. Oak and vanilla intensive but nice. Highly recommended.

A Portuguese bargain!
Rich , Bold and Fruity. 
A good as it gets for €13!
Tip top for the dosh. Glacé cherries and damson jam. Massive fan of soy soused pork. And maybe a lamb chop.
Full bodied, well balanced, dark fruit, notes of oak and leather, medium tannins and acidity. Enjoyed with steak.
Cassis, red plums, red cherries,  tobacco. Intense, balanced, length. Fathersday drinks at golf club.
Flavours of vanilla blackcurrant cherry. Oak and a level of minerality. Fairly tannic. Lots going on. Recommended.
Brilliant yellow color brioche and buttery taste,  Citrus and jasmine, dry and mineral and heavy sur lie fermentation.
Cherry and plum fruit, gentle oak and tannins present but not overbearing.  Beautifully constructed wine.
Smells like berry, wood and oak intense, full flavour on the mouth, equilibrated taninos with an exceptional finish
I like this style. Has to be some T National grapes involved. Body, Oak vanilla, black- & blue berries. My rating from vintage 2017 was higher

4.1/5. Lovely full bodied wine.
Blend of indigenous grapes and CS.
Nose is full of ripe black fruit, oak, vanilla and menthol.
High tannins that are rounded. Medium acidity.
Palate is long with ripe black fruit and some spices. Quite complex.
Will definitely buy again.

Strongly divided opinions - more than any wine. 4 stars from me. 1.5 from Annie. Intense nose of black currant, dark fruit and leather with liquorice and something lighter-mint perhaps. Plus forest floor and other secondary aromas. Intense on the palate too. Complex but fruit forward with liquorice noticeable. Soft mouthfeel. Good tannins. Too Intense for Annie - all secondary flavours, intensity and smokey with not enough fruit for her. After 1/4 glass she gave the rest to me. I would buy again Annie never.

Excellent red from Herdade do Esporão. It is a blend of CS, Alicante Bouchet and Syrag. Intense ruby, intense aroma of cherry and plum, oak (vanilla, toasted) and spicy notes. Medium+ body, balanced, soft, medium finish.

Right on the edge of suicide, brownish to brick color medium minus intensity, aromas of earth and dried leaves with a reminder of dark jammed fruit... The amount of Cabernet Sauvignon they used to apply in the blend still saved it from the certain death, so you have some fun drinking it! The taste of dried roses the hint of old dark chocolate and spices from last century, allows you to imagine this wine when it was still willing to live and pleasure your palate... God by my friend, don't fall to hard...

The wine is dry with high acidity, medium+ alcohol, medium body, medium flavour intensity and a long finish.

Notes of woody spices, grapefruit, vanilla and white pepper.

Really interesting sounding Portuguese blend. Brought this to Xmas eve dinner but was a bit disappointed. Too oaky. The finish did have a lot of black fruit like blackberry & plum emerge, but most of the sip it tastes like oak. I like oakiness, but I’m not looking for fermented trees.

Passa 12 meses em carvalho, o que parece ser o tempo certo.
Frutas vermelhas maduras, canela, pimenta negra, café e chocolate amargo.

It spends 12 months in oak, which seems like the right time.

🇬🇧 Red wine  Alentejo, with 14,5%. Made using Alicante Bouschet, Aragonez, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional e Trincadeira. Aged during 12 months in barrel. Good but not my type of wine. Cheers 🍷

At the restaurant with no Italians on the wine list 2: I ordered this red that had 12 months of wood aging and… proudly showed it from nose to finish. It’s a powerful little wine with solid tannins that released some black juices, ditto fruits and plums. It gave us a rich mouth feel and lots of pleasant soft oak. Not too unbalanced now, but probably way better in some years.

A little alcoholic in the beginning, with vanilla, red/dark fruits, oaks. Pair with something high fat such as ossobuco, risotto.

$24 B Village, like the Portuguese version of Saladin (blend) but richer with less spice
Good easy drinking Portuguese red blend .  Oak and cassis nose.  Blackberry notes with white pepper finish. Nicely blended smooth tannins . Deceptive 14.5 alcohol.
Dark burgundy with purple edge. Nose fruity with spice and some herbal tones. Palate full and pleasant with good fruit concentration. A pleasant wine.
Intense red from Esporão. Torrefaction, loads of red and blue fruit. Espresso, charcoal. If you need a red wine to impress your guest at your bbq roast try this one.
A dark vivid violet wine from Alentejo with a firm body and full of plums and berries. The wine is intense and I think it was a mistake to have it open so soon.
3.5 Recovers a bit in a glass. Fruit compote (seems to be a bit boiled). Moderate density body with remaining black and red berries with foliage and twigs.
Lovely red wine. Needs to wait for awhile. After 15 min it is ready to be enjoyed. Chocolate and some fruit flavors are the main taste of this grate wine.
Quite surprising expression of cab sav. Rich and suave on palate, dark and red berries, smooth tanins, vanilla, easy to drink. Maybe lack of complexity.
(88) (18.-) Dark fruits and herbal notes, slightly ethereal; good sweetness and density, fine tannins, the fruit is covered by wood, short and almost bitter finish.
Clear, deep purple colour, med intensity on the nose, black & red fruits, hint of vanilla, med bodied, med tannins and acidity, 과일향과 오크풍미가 매력적이고 매끄러운 와인
The only Portuguese wine from this trip that I would actually buy to drink again. Has an old world dustiness that is pleasant to drink. Good with food.

My initial notes lead to herbaceousness with dark red fruit notes resembling the almost ripe cherry. Similar qualities lead my palate in the black fruit department. The herbs speak earthy lyrics and the tannins make for a consistent assistant, not too aggressive but never a pushover. It's summer time so I'd recommend this for a closing wine contribution to a great night with friends who speak your culinary language in a backyard somewhere under the starlight. Pair with water as this piece fucks at %14.5.

Balanced in the best way possible and that’s a big compliment, there’s nothing boring with this one, the opposite. All the right ingredients are there: ruby coloured, plenty of cherry and fresh oak in the nose and a remarkable flavour of seasonal red berries. The balance though, is there. Feels like a fully bodied red bit it is not overwhelming... not a cold winter wine, not a summer one: works in every season. Salud!

Big, big wine that’s dark ruby in appearance. 

Plum, underripe raspberry and blackberry, Chinese 5 spice. This grape blend is able to take on an impressive amount of oak. 

This wine provides the pallet with surprisingly soft tannins but with a long lasting finish just to complicate things.

Hints of what I like about alentejo but not there. Lovely chocolate nose with some smoke. Smooth beginning with hints of vanilla, moving to red fruit, subtly, and leaving even further hints of plum with cranberries being all over the place.

Lots of red fruit, surprisingly light. Expected a bit more complexity and intensity. I guess if I hadn’t been craving “bigness” this would have been just fine. Blueberry juice, some powdery mocha, no tannins. Not very Iberian somehow. Reminds me of new style natural juice from Languedoc and Rhône. 

Very strange to read other reviews talking about 0ak and vanîlla ..

3 Wine Men Portugal tasting. 3y6m.
C: Deep purple
N: Intense blackberry, cassis, strawberry jam, v light oak & green herbs. Simple, med clarity.
P: Blackberry, cassis -> exotic spices, pepper, oak -> strawberry jam & green herbs. Med length, conc & bod, med+ acid & grippy tannins. Pretty balanced, not very refined but not bad.
87p.

Deep purple. Medium plus aroma and flavour intensity of black fruit vanilla sweet spice. Dry. Medium to medium plus acidity and a tannins are high.  Full body high alcohol and a medium plus finish. Quality is very good and suitable for ageing

👍👍 ES92 RP91 AD92. Blend of Alicante Bouschet, Aragonez, Trincadeira & Cab Sauv from Alentejo, Portugal. Explosion of ripe red fruit nose. Soft tannins. 14.5% alcohol. Tasted with Zalto Bourgnone wine glass. Clube Adega Platinum (Qualimpor)
oak vanilla blackberry cherry plum black fruit pepper high in alcohol, bit of sting on the nose, quite decent wine, but not as good as the rating average.... but hey, that’s just one mans opinion 😘🤪

It has good aromas and flavors of fresh fruit (black fruit / red fruit) and woody.  Hot profile. New world style. Ruby / violet color, full-bodied, med-dry. In the sensory dimension it's a pleasant wine from the Alentejo region.
On the non-sensory level, the label reveals the presence of sulfites and 14.5% ABV, an alcoholic value, which I consider uncomfortable for a meal and therefore a very ungastronomic aspect.

My first venture into this region with these grapes. Cherry on the nose & strong black fruits especially blackberries on the palate. Medium to bold with a finish that didn’t have too much pepper. Decent example.

3.5
I have had 3 different varieties of wine from this winery and all are exceptional. Old schools craftsmanship comes through in this slightly smoky, tobacco, earthy, wine. Dryer finish, great with food.

Bold full bodied Portuguese red wine from Alentejo region. Cuvée from Aragonez, Trincadeira, Cab sauvignon and Alicante Bouschet, 14,5% abv, full bodied, little unbalanced in terms of acidity, for the boldness I miss some sweetness. Lots of black and red berries fruits both in the nose and on the palate. On the palate also redberries jam, orange zest, sour cherry, honey, walnuts. Medium persistence. Solid wine but not worth the money in my humble opinion.

Oak and blackcurrant on the nose. Dark cloudy crimson with thick legs 14.5%. Well balanced. Lots of acid and alcohol and mild but evident tannins. Blackcurrant and bramble and a hint of vanilla and a little dark chocolate. Full body moderate length. Ageing potential

WSET catch up notes.
Deep ruby. Med+ intensity nose,
Cooked black cherries and plums, blackberries, violet. Vanilla from the oak and hints of tertiary prune and tobacco. Dry, high acidity, high (ripe) tannins, high alc, full bodied. Med+ intensity flavours of cooked black fruit, med+ finish with noticeable heat. V good (esp at price level) but alc didn’t feel particularly well integrated overall and fruit a touch overripe for higher rating.

With a light dinner of toasted and well buttered pan de mie and a selection of cheeses ( Roquefort, young goat, brillat savarin brie). At 6 years, this 2016 reserva is throwing sediment but has a deep ruby with nice ede. Ight aromatic wood is apparent and I percieve ripe plum in the forward taste receefing to complexity. Awesome with goat cheese on well buttered pan de mie toast. plum plum tobacco

かなり濃くて、カオールの黒とも言えるくらいの深い色合い。香りはシック、ブルーベリーやタバコ。
味わいも素晴らしいバランス。熟したアメリカンチェリー、とろける舌触り、後に残るタンニン、主役級。これはリピしたい。ネットで25ドルでした。
Сбалансированный вкус. По носу трава, вишня, зелёное яблоко. По вкусу — свежесть травы, немного лайм и яблоко. Плотное, насыщенный цвет, стоит охладить
Cor rubi. Aromas de frutas escuras, chocolate e baunilha. Na boca estava com um toque de chocolate excelente. Encorpado, boa estrutura, equilíbrio e elegante.

Great Reserva 2019 from Esporao. Blend of Alicante Bouschet, Aragonez, Trincadeira and Cabernet Sauvignon. Love this wine since 20 years ago. Very bold but smooth. Oak, vanilla, chocolate and blackberry.
Grande reserva 2019 do Esporao. Blend de Alicante Bouschet, Aragonez, Trincadeira e Cabernet Sauvignon. Adoro este vinho ha 20 anos. Suave e encorpado. Carvalho, Baunilha, chocolate e amora.

Bordeau donker van kleur. Ruikt erg fruitig en bloemig. Donker rood fruit, pruim met hout. Smaakt naar; kruidig en pruim. Heeft veel tannines maar wel goede body.  Erg lekker! Mijn favoriet van het amsterdam wijn festival

Excelente vinho Português do Alentejo, Esporão Reserva. Denso. Sabor de frutas vermelhas e negras. Adocicado e apimentado. Notas de cerejas, framboesas e mirtilos. Toques de chocolate e baunilha. Aftertaste longevo. Recomendo fortemente.

Um clássico alentejano que sempre agrada. 
Blend de Alicante Bouschet, TN, Aragonez, Syrah, Trincadeira, CS, TF.
12 meses de barricas americanas e francesas. 
👁 rubi profundo. 
👃 frutas negras,  amora,  ameixa,  cassis,  tostado,  especiarias doces e condimentadas. 
👄 seco, encorpado,  taninos macios,  acidez ativa,  com o retorno das frutas negras e especiarias por todo o palato. 
Final longo e persistente. 
Acompanhou strogonoff de carne.
Vino de Alentejo con un color rubí intenso y translúcido, en nariz aromas de frutas rojas maduras y madera en boca redondo y de final largo. Muy rico!
Sehr dunkles, dichtes Purpurrot im Glas. Schöne fruchtige Vanillenote in der Nase. Im Gaumen dunkle Beeren, dicht, rund, leichtes Leder, dezenter Pfeffer mit wunderschönem Fass. Abgang mittellang.
Topper! Zacht, zwoel, vanille, rijp bosfruit, beetje chocolade. Complex en intens maar niet te zwaar. Ideaal bij een borrelplank met (gedroogde) charcuterie, rijpe kazen en goede gesprekken.
Hammer PLV, in dieser Preisklasse fast unschlagbar🍷👍😋Schon in der Nase eine Wucht, wunderschöner Abgang, macht SPASS dieser Tropfen, bin begeisert! Warum hab ich nur ne einzelne Flasche gekauft😅
Mooi glas. Kers. Blauw fruit. Ruw op de tong. Weinig tannines. Leer in de afdronk. Niet helemaal rond waardoor niet de typische easy pleaser. Verfijnd wijntje. Goede prijs.
Maravilhoso! Melhorou muito em relação a 2018!!! Madeira equilibrada com frutos vermelhos maduros e um pouco de compota, perfume do bosque… taninos super equilibrados em um boca muito longa…
Um 4.3 sensacional. 1 ano de barrica e uma hora de decanter deixaram o vinho suave e muito bom de beber. Pouco álcool ; só no final; baunilha carvalho e especiarias. Sensacional

Vinho seco e novo, com aroma frutado.

Vinhassooo! Simples assim... Vinho com estrutura e complexidade, taninos bem aveludados que traz uma ótima maciez no paladar... Vinho que acaba e agente nem percebe kkkkk!

Voici un excellent vin du Portugal que tous nos invités ont fort apprécié. Belle touche de fruits murs sur une longueur en bouche. On en aurait bien repris une seconde bouteille.
Vin puissant avec goût de vanille et de mûres. Malgré que mon odorat et goût soit affecté par la COVID, ce vin a su se démarquer! Dégusté avec avec une fondue chinoise 🫕 le 27-10-2022.
Coloração vermelho intenso. Aroma de floresta molhada, compota de frutas negras maduras. Taninos equilibrados, presença de baunilha, frutas negras, especiarias e Carvalho envelhecido.
Fantástico vinho produzido pela herdade do Esporão. Corpo texturado e de boa expressão tânica com elevada intensidade e músculo numa linha contrária a muitos dos seus congêneres alentejanos…vinhaço.

Excelente reserva.

Vinho cuja procedência já fala por si só. Profundo, potente, complexo, muito equilibrado, notas olfativas tostadas com bastante fruta, para um sabor sempre perfeito e persistente. Muito bom vinho.

Herrlich Fruchtig süffig gute Struktur voller Körper, Kirschrot im Glas, Dörrfrüchte Röstaromen mit Zwetschgen Pflaumen Note. Schöne Fülle gute Dichte,Gut gereifte Tannine sehr lange im Abgang.
4.1 ⭐️ - Delícia de vinho como todos do Esporão, hoje acompanhado de um bom bacalhau provei as safras 2009, 2010 e 2011. Em minha opinião a 2011 supera as demais, mas todos são excelentes…. 🍷🇵🇹

Sempre uma escolha certeira e garantia de uma experiência com qualidade.

O vinho está pronto. Comprei na caixa vertical de 11 a 14. Falta somente o 11. Gostei mais do 12,14 e por último do 13
biscuit, vanille, fruits rouges, il s'ouvre au fil des heures pour libérer douceur, rondeur et ampleur. Très agréable. Belle puissance mais sans dominance. Très belle découverte.
Viva !!!! Ao mesmo tempo que os taninos davam o ar da graça, esse vinho mostrava um corpo de preencher a boca, com boa persistência e retrogosto q garante boa experiência.
Cor granada, frutas vermelhas maduras, intenso, pimentas, especiarias,pouco de madeira, taninos fortes, final persistente,vinho de ótima pegada, complexo, um ótimo vinho!
Aromas intensos com muita baunilha, frutas vermelhas, especiarias, cacau, mentol e tostados. Paladar seco, com corpo médio, madeira bem integrada, taninos finos e acidez equilibrada!
Com 11 anos de safra apresenta coloração bem escura, na boca, predominam frutas negras com taninos amaciados e acidez na medida certa.Não evoluirá mais com a guarda.Saude!🍷🍷🍷🍷
Muito bom vinho!! Madeira presente, boa concentração de fruta e corpo! 👍👍👍 um pouco caro no Brasil, mas entrega muito a um custo nem tão grande assim! Vale a compra! Nota 3,9 ⭐️

Muito bom..cor intensa e paladar diferenciado..marcante e presença de madeira,tabaco,com  notas de cereja.
Acompanha muito bem com javali, lebre e outras carnes de caça..
Muito bom alentejano. Aroma de frutas vermelhas mescladas com coco, baunilha e carvalho. Taninos fortes, cor rubi profunda e bastante corpo. Dos últimos vinhos de 2015 !!
Adoro esse vinho, sempre correto. Frutas vermelhas maduras, compota, madeira, especiarias e toque de café e chocolate. Taninos firmes mas corretos. Álcool e acidez na medida. Recomendo sempre!
Um vinho com notas de torrado e madeira, bem aromático. Ele possui um teor álcoolico um pouco acentuado, mas que foi ganhando equilíbrio com o tempo. Um ótimo blend português!
O melhor restaurante português de SP pede um Português Reserva. Vinho com corpo médio e taninos macios. Final persistente. Excelente opção para nossa última noite em SP !

Esporão colheita 2013, decantado 2 horas antes.
